jsymbolic2.configuration.txtimplementation

Class ConfigurationFileValidatorTxtImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • jsymbolic2.configuration.ConfigurationFileValidator
      • jsymbolic2.configuration.txtimplementation.ConfigurationFileValidatorTxtImpl

  • public class ConfigurationFileValidatorTxtImpl
extends ConfigurationFileValidator
    An implementation of the ConfigurationFileValidator class. This deals with the validation and parsing of the .txt implementation of the configuration file validator.

      • validateFeatureSyntax

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> validateFeatureSyntax(java.util.List<java.lang.String> rawConfigFile,
                                                              java.io.File configurationFile)
                                                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Validate the syntax of the features specified in the rawConfigFile. This includes verifying that each feature is in fact a valid jSymbolic feature name corresponding to the appropriate FeatureDefinition of that feature.
        Specified by:
        validateFeatureSyntax in class ConfigurationFileValidator
        Parameters:
        rawConfigFile - A list of strings containing the line by line raw configuration file.
        configurationFile - The configuration file for file information.
        Returns:
        A list of strings containing the line by line raw configuration file, with the feature syntax validated.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown if a particular feature is not valid in jSymbolic.

      • validateOptionSyntax

        public ConfigurationOptionState validateOptionSyntax(java.util.List<java.lang.String> rawConfigFile,
                                                     java.io.File configurationFile)
                                              throws java.lang.Exception
        Validate the syntax of the options in the rawConfigFile input. This deals with the verifications made in the checkOptionLine(String, List, int, File) function, which validates syntax and type for the options. It also validates that all the options do in fact exist in the configuration file.
        Specified by:
        validateOptionSyntax in class ConfigurationFileValidator
        Parameters:
        rawConfigFile - A list of strings containing the line by line raw configuration file.
        configurationFile - The configuration file for file information.
        Returns:
        The option state of the configuration file through a ConfigurationOptionState object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown if option syntax or format is invalid.

      • validateOptionLogic

        public ConfigurationOptionState validateOptionLogic(ConfigurationOptionState configOption,
                                                    java.io.File configurationFile)
                                             throws java.lang.Exception
        Validate the logic of the options in the passed in configOption state object. This currently ensures that the save overall recording features and save windowed recording features are not the same boolean value.
        Specified by:
        validateOptionLogic in class ConfigurationFileValidator
        Parameters:
        configOption - The syntax validated configuration option data.
        configurationFile - The configuration file for file information.
        Returns:
        The configuration option state with the validated logic.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown if overall and windowed recording feature option are the same boolean value.

      • checkForInvalidInputFiles

        public ConfigurationInputFiles checkForInvalidInputFiles(java.util.List<java.lang.String> rawConfigFile,
                                                         java.io.File configurationFile)
                                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Implementation for the checking of invalid input files. Only single mei and midi files are allowed as per the use of the Music File Filter. Any invalid files will be added to the invalid log which this function will return. Directories are also considered invalid and will not be processed and simply returned in the invalid return log.
        Specified by:
        checkForInvalidInputFiles in class ConfigurationFileValidator
        Parameters:
        rawConfigFile - The configuration file that needs to be checked.
        configurationFile - The configuration file for file information.
        Returns:
        A list of invalid files and directories specified in the configuration file.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown if input file is not valid.

      • checkForInvalidOutputFiles

        public ConfigurationOutputFiles checkForInvalidOutputFiles(java.util.List<java.lang.String> rawConfigFile,
                                                           java.io.File configurationFile)
                                                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Checks for invalid output files in the given configuration file. This needs to be of the precise format <output_files> header with 2 fields below it. These 2 fields need to be in the format 1) feature_values_save_path=test_value.xml 2) feature_definitions_save_path=test_definition.xml and the specified files need to exist and be accessible in the local system. Anything else will result in a thrown exception.
        Specified by:
        checkForInvalidOutputFiles in class ConfigurationFileValidator
        Parameters:
        rawConfigFile - The raw line by line configuration file that needs to be validated.
        configurationFile - The configuration file for file information.
        Returns:
        A List of the valid files. Index 1 would contain feature value save path and index 2 would contain feature definition save path.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - thrown if format is wrong or if path does not exist in local system

      • validateHeaders

        public void validateHeaders(java.util.List<java.lang.String> rawConfigFile,
                            java.io.File configurationFile,
                            java.util.List<HeaderEnum> headersToCheck)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Validates if all headers to check in HeaderEnum are in the specified configuration file.
        Specified by:
        validateHeaders in class ConfigurationFileValidator
        Parameters:
        rawConfigFile - Raw string lines of the configuration file.
        configurationFile - The original configuration file for extra data (e.g. file name).
        headersToCheck - Headers that need to be checked in the configuration file.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown if any header in the HeaderEnum is missing and if headers that do not need to be checked are found in the configuration file.
